content: quick crocheted button so i don t always have buttons handy and they can be kind of expensive on top of that sometimes you need a button in a color you just don t have so i came up with this super quick pattern for making buttons i like it because all you need is yarn and a crochet hook to make the button and it s thick enough and stiff enough to stand on it s own as a button you can make bigger or smaller sizes using thicker or finer yarn coupled with changing your hook size as needed materials needed small amount of yarn in your choice of gauge and color crochet hook in your choice of sized i used a worsted weight yarn red heart supersaver and a 4 5 mm crochet hook and got a button slightly smaller than a quarter start a magic_ring leaving a long tail for sewing 1 single_crochet 10 into the magic_ring join with a slip_stitch to first single_crochet to close circle 2 pull the tail left for sewing tight to close the magic_ring and tie a knot at the base so that the ring does not expand 3 chain 1 slip_stitch all the way around 10 sts slip_stitch to chain 1 to close tie off and weave in this end but leave the long tail unwoven so that you can attach the button wherever you need it - this pattern is copyright november 2008 by nichole m verville you may use this pattern for personal use but do not sell this pattern if you use this pattern i must be credited for it you may sell the finished product from this pattern but i must be credited for the pattern note i realize there are a lot of patterns out there for buttons and whatnot i just came up with this one in this stitch count on the fly and decided to publish/post it if for some reason someone else has already posted this pattern as their own before me please tell me so i can put the link in my blog otherwise should you use my pattern well then please respect my copyright -
